page.title: 15GLOUCESTER MARATHON
page.content: THE GLOUCESTER MARATHON IS ONE OF THE LARGER 26.2 MILE RACES IN THE COUNTRY. IT WAS FIRST RUN ON THE FIRST SUNDAY OF OCTOBER IN 1981. IN 1984 THE FIRST BRITISH SPORTS ASSOCIATION FOR THE DISABLED CHAMPIONSHIP WAS HELD IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE GLOUCESTER MARATHON. THE 1985 RACE SEES THE 2ND B.S.A.D. EVENT IN GLOUCESTER AS WELL AS THE BRITISH MARATHON RUNNERS CLUB CHAMPIONSHIPS. IN 1984 1137 RUNNERS FINISHED. 183 IN UNDER 3 HOURS. MARATHON RUNNING HAS BEEN VERY POPULAR EVER SINCE THE FIRST LONDON MARATHON IN APRIL 1981. THE LOCAL PAPER HAS A COLUMN GIVING TRAINING ADVICE WHILST IT IS SPONSORED BY A PAPER CALLED "CARFINDER".
